entries.title: U.S. Extends Troop Deployment in Romania, at Ukraine War’s Doorstep
entries.description: The buildup is part of President Biden’s commitment to increase American forces in Europe in response to the Russian invasion last February.

entries.title: London Museum Removes ‘Irish Giant’ Skeleton From Display
entries.description: The remains of Charles Byrne, a 7-foot-7 man who died in 1783, will no longer be on public view, an effort to address what one official at the Hunterian Museum called a historical wrong.

entries.title: Despite German Reluctance, Ukraine Expresses Optimism About Receiving Tanks
entries.description: Even as frustration mounts over what some see as Germany’s indecision on sending Leopard 2s to Ukraine, a Kyiv official says his country’s soldiers will begin training on them.

entries.title: Pakistan Strengthens Laws Against Blasphemy
entries.description: Insulting Islam or its founder is already a capital offense, but now those who insult people connected to the Prophet Muhammad could get prison time.

entries.title: Rian Johnson’s New Old Show
entries.description: “Poker Face” debuts next week. Could the throwback, case-of-the-week format be a cure for streaming woes?

entries.title: Pushing Alcohol While Health Experts Say Risk-Free Drinking Is a Myth
entries.description: New alcohol guidelines say that not drinking is the only way to cut risk, but government-owned stores aggressively promote liquor, beer and wine.

entries.title: Taiwan’s Top Diplomat in Washington Walks a Delicate Line
entries.description: Taiwan’s representative, Bi-khim Hsiao, calls herself a “cat warrior” walking a delicate diplomatic line. China calls her a troublemaker who could trigger a war.

entries.title: A Hit French Novel Tries to Explain Putin. Too Well, Some Critics Say.
entries.description: A popular novel, “The Wizard of the Kremlin,” presents a sympathetic portrait of the Russian leader, critics say, raising concerns that it might influence national policy toward the Ukraine war.

entries.title: One Saturday in Dnipro, When a Russian Missile Shattered Lives
entries.description: Despite the ever-present danger of war, life in Ukraine proceeds almost normally at times. Then, suddenly, it all changes, as it did in Dnipro after a missile struck an apartment complex.

entries.title: The NATO Alliance Is Holding Strong on Ukraine. But Fractures Are Emerging.
entries.description: The allies differ on strategy for the coming year and the more immediate question of what Ukraine needs ahead of a major offensive in the spring.

entries.title: Guatemala Targets Colombia’s Defense Minister in Crackdown on Anticorruption Forces
entries.description: The defense minister had led an anticorruption task force in Guatemala for several years. The authorities also announced arrest warrants against former investigators for the group.
